ar.com.hjg.pngj

Class ChunkSeqReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ar.com.hjg.pngj.ChunkSeqReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBytesConsumer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChunkSeqReaderPng

    public class ChunkSeqReader
extends Object
implements IBytesConsumer
    Consumes a stream of bytes that consist of a series of PNG-like chunks.

    This has little intelligence, it's quite low-level and general (it could even be used for a MNG stream, for example). It supports signature recognition.

    • Method Detail

      • consume

        public int consume(byte[] buffer,
          int offset,
          int len)
        Consumes (in general, partially) a number of bytes. A single call never involves more than one chunk. When the signature is read, it calls checkSignature() When the start of a chunk is detected, it calls startNewChunk(int, String, long) When data from a chunk is being read, it delegates to ChunkReader.feedBytes(byte[], int, int) The caller might want to call this method more than once in succesion This should rarely be overriden
        Specified by:
        consume in interface IBytesConsumer
        Parameters:
        buffer -
        offset - Offset in buffer
        len - Valid bytes that can be consumed
        Returns:
        processed bytes, in the 1-len range. -1 if done. Only returns 0 if len=0.

      • feedAll

        public boolean feedAll(byte[] buf,
              int off,
              int len)
        Trys to feeds exactly len bytes, calling consume(byte[], int, int) retrying if necessary. This should only be used in callback mode
        Returns:
        true if succceded

      • startNewChunk

        protected void startNewChunk(int len,
                 String id,
                 long offset)
        Called when a chunk start has been read (id and length), before the chunk data itself is read. It creates a new ChunkReader (field accesible via getCurChunkReader()) in the corresponding mode, and eventually a curReaderDeflatedSet.(field accesible via getCurReaderDeflatedSet()) To decide the mode and options, it calls shouldCheckCrc(int, String), shouldSkipContent(int, String), isIdatKind(String). Those methods should be overriden in preference to this. The respective ChunkReader.chunkDone() method is directed to this postProcessChunk(ChunkReader).

      • postProcessChunk

        protected void postProcessChunk(ChunkReader chunkR)
        This is called after a chunk is read, in all modes. This implementation only chenks the id of the first chunk, and process the IEND chunk (sets done=true) Further processing should be overriden (call this first!)

      • createIdatSet

        protected DeflatedChunksSet createIdatSet(String id)
        DeflatedChunksSet factory. This implementation is quite dummy, it usually should be overriden.

      • isIdatKind

        protected boolean isIdatKind(String id)
        Decides if this Chunk is of "IDAT" kind (in concrete: if it is, and if it's not to be skiped, a DeflatedChunksSet will be created to deflate it and process+ the deflated data) This implementation return false.
        Parameters:
        id -

      • shouldSkipContent

        protected boolean shouldSkipContent(int len,
                        String id)
        Chunks can be skipped depending on id and/or length. Skipped chunks are still processed, but their data will be null, and CRC will never checked
        Parameters:
        len -
        id -

      • shouldCheckCrc

        protected boolean shouldCheckCrc(int len,
                     String id)

      • checkSignature

        protected void checkSignature(byte[] buf)
        Throws PngjInputException if bad signature
        Parameters:
        buf - Signature. Should be of length 8

      • isSignatureDone

        public boolean isSignatureDone()
        If false, we are still reading the signature
        Returns:
        true if signature has been read (or if we don't have signature)

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        If true, we either have processe the IEND chunk, or close() has been called, or a fatal error has happened

      • getBytesCount

        public long getBytesCount()
        total of bytes read (buffered or not)

      • getChunkCount

        public int getChunkCount()
        Returns:
        Chunks already read, including partial reading (currently reading)

      • getCurChunkReader

        public ChunkReader getCurChunkReader()
        Currently reading chunk, or just ended reading
        Returns:
        null only if still reading signature

      • getCurReaderDeflatedSet

        public DeflatedChunksSet getCurReaderDeflatedSet()
        The current deflated set (typically IDAT chunks) reader. This is not null only while reading that set. Notice that there could be several idat sets (eg for APNG)

      • close

        public void close()
        Forces a closing (abort)

      • isAtChunkBoundary

        public boolean isAtChunkBoundary()
        Returns true if we are not in middle of a chunk: we have just ended reading past chunk , or we are at the start, or end of signature, or we are done

      • firstChunkId

        protected String firstChunkId()
        Which should be the id of the first chunk
        Returns:
        null if you don't want to check it

      • endChunkId

        protected String endChunkId()
        Which should be the id of the last chunk
        Returns:
        "IEND"
